track.name: Leaving Trunk
comments: Woke up with 'em three different ways
... Too sharp at the start but it smooths out later on into the song.

used to work with a couple of young guys from the south side of chicago back in the late 70s- the one was a guitarist and pretty good as i understand-he once told me he loved taj-at the time i had no idea he was- man --- i wish i had that time back
I'll second that. First two albums were the best. Third was more country blues but after that he started getting distracted with the Africa roots stuff.
Talented for sure, but he changed genres so often he kinda got lost. For me, he shoulda stuck with the National Steelbody
or maybe the cat from little feat.
am i losing it?maybe...be that as it may,in my opinion the drums on this track remind me of levon helms stutter style.
and hell yeah,i can always spare a toke......lol can always use one too...hehehe!
levon helm? are you losing it...dont get me wrong..i love taj and levon both but there is no comparing one to the other.they sound nothing alike....they are both their own islands.....
love the drums on this track.sounds like levon helm
A long time taj favorite of mine. possibly my favorite song by him!
Funky raw electric blues at its best with a legendary singer and masterful guitarist (Jesse Ed Davis) at their absolute peak. Their first album ("Taj Mahal") is a blues classic.
